The investigator follow 6 week post-op evaluate wound complication . There minimal risk participant incision type acceptable current obstetrical practice . There direct benefit patient . Currently , level I evidence support either Pfannenstiel midline vertical skin incision prevention wound complication obese patient undergo cesarean section . Therefore , current practice surgeon make decision base preference weigh theoretic risk . Therefore , clinical equipoise . Cesarean section common procedure , national rate 32 % live birth 2007 . Not obesity increase expectant mother 's risk cesarean section , also well recognize risk factor wound complication . The cesarean wound complication rate morbidly obese population University Of Texas Houston - Memorial Hermann Hospital Texas Medical Center 2011 roughly twenty time high normal weight population , 28 % compare 1.4 % . Results study could extrapolate future affect low post-operative morbidity , high patient satisfaction , less antibiotic use , short hospital stay , overall low health care cost .
